channel.title: Ypsilanti Michigan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti
channel.description: Recent content in Ypsilanti Michigan on Vacuum weblog from Edward Vielmetti

item.title: I voted, summer 2015 edition
item.description:
Ann Arbor is one of three peculiar communities in the state of Michigan to have partisan City Council elections; the other two are Ypsilanti and Ionia. This has in recent years meant that the races that decide the makeup of City Council happen in the summer when students are gone and when voter turnout is very low.

I did vote, and I do plan to go to at least one of the parties celebrating victory or acknowledging defeat by the candidates who have the remaining funds from their campaign to put out a nice spread for supporters, hangers-on, or the perpetually politically curious.

After a few rounds of picking up result tapes from Ward Four precincts, I ended up at Arbor Brewing Company which was Council Party HQ.

Winners:

  • First Ward: Sabra Briere over Will Leaf, handily with 70%+ of the vote, though only 6% of registered voters actually voted.
  • Second Ward: We’ll wait until the fall for this as Jane Lumm (I) meets Sally Hart Petersen (D) in November.
  • Third Ward: Zachary Ackerman defeats Steve Kunselman by about 40 votes. This was the surprise of the night. Ackerman’s entire margin of victory was his strong showing in 3-3 (Burns Park) where he outpaced Kunselman 345-171. Turnout was under 11%.
  • Fourth Ward: Jack Eaton defeats Jamie Magiera with about 60% of the vote. Jack held his party at Wolverine Brewing; Jamie was at ABC, looking subdued. Turnout was about 10%.
  • Fifth Ward: Chip Smith defeated Mike Anglin with about 55% of the vote. Voter turnout in the mighty Fifth Ward was strong compared to the other wards, with a mighty 14% of the electorate turning out to vote.

Losers:

  • The 85%+ of Ann Arbor voters who didn’t know enough or didn’t bother to turn out to vote.

Details:

  • UnOfficial Election Results, August 4, 2015 City Primary Election, Wasthenaw County

item.title: restaurant inspections
item.description:
Every month the Washtenaw County Health Department does a round of restaurant inspections. Wayne Eaker built an importer that pulls in data from the site that hosts the official county inspections, and is storing the inspection data on Github to make it easier for the next person who wants to build a nice interface to all the data.

Wayne was good enough to find a spot to host an interface to this data that lets you browse through it; you can find it at

http://food-inspections.annarbortelegraph.com

There are permalinks to each inspection so that you can link to them. See e.g. recent inspections for

  • Slurping Turtle, June 17, 2015
  • China Chef, Ypsilanti, April 27, 2015
  • Nu Wave Fish and Chicken, June 22, 2015

for three examples of places where I want to see a clean inspection on a followup visit before I go or go back to there.

item.title: 10/4 4-5p FLY Art Center volunteer orientation, FLY Creativity Lab, Ypsilanti
item.description:
Christine Bruxvoort sent me these details on the FLY Art Center's upcoming volunteer orientation.

When the volunteer orientation is going to be: Oct 4, 2014 4:00 p.m. - 5:00 p.m.

Where it's going to be: FLY Creativity Lab, 40 N. Huron, Ypsilanti, 48197 (between Michigan and Pearl). Contact: Chris at 734-217-2228 or info@flyartcenter.org.

Who is invited: Any interested adult or teen. Come to find out what we are about or sign up that night on our volunteer list.

What kind of commitment is asked for: on going opportunities that are posted through the volunteer sign up page. Adults can also sign up for committees like fundraising and marketing that meet monthly. Other opportunities involve working with kids or in the community at events.

Why you're so awesome: FLY is awesome because we are dedicated to our community and to our FLY kids! FLY means FOR the LOVE of YOUTH and we are proud to serve our area with quality arts programming that can transform our neighborhoods, develop confidence skills in our young ones, and expand the opportunities for arts and culture in our community. Our caring volunteers and staff are essential to making this happen.

Thanks so much! We haven't worked much yet with teens but I am excited about the possibilities of using youth as mentors to our children. Please let me know if you have anymore questions about FLY. We really appreciate your support.

item.title: Ann Arbor area closings for Monday, 18 November 2013
item.description:
High winds took down trees and knocked out power to thousands in Washtenaw County the night of 17 November 2013, and the next morning a number of schools and government offices closed because of lack of power.

From various sources including email and twitter; this is surely incomplete.

Ann Arbor Public Schools: Tappan and King are closed today due to power outages at both schools. Tonight's Listen and Learn at Tappan will be rescheduled. Bryant Elementary now closed in Ann Arbor due to power outage-caused heating failure. Students that arrived at school sent back home.

Ann Arbor District Library: "The power is out at Malletts Creek Branch, it is currently closed. All other @aadl locations will open at 10 AM. Stay tuned for updates!"

Ypsilanti Township offices are closed.

14-B District Court is closed.

Eastern Michigan University: Rec/IM: Due to technical problems, the Jones Pool will be closed until further notice. We apologize for the inconvenience. (via @EMU_Swoop)

Chelsea Police say power is still out and is expected to be out for "the next several hours," as of 8:15 a.m. Chelsea schools have also been closed. (Heritage News) Chelsea Center for the Arts will be closed today, Monday, November 18, 2013 due to a citywide power outage.

item.title: Hit and run in Ypsilanti - seeking driver of early 90s Chevy Corsica - Motorcycle accident Friday August 9, 2013 Downtown Ypsilanti (W. Forest Ave at N. Hamilton St. Ypsi)
item.description:
A friend of mine was in a motorcycle accident in Ypsilanti on Friday, August 9, 2013. Here's her posting to Craigslist about it - there is a reward offered for identification of the driver that caused the crash. Contact her through this email address: ttrfq-3993561879@comm.craigslist.org

 Motorcycle accident 08/09/13 Downtown Ypsilanti (W. Forest Ave at N. Hamilton St. Ypsi)

*Possible Reward, if vehicle driver identified*

My partner and I were involved in a motorcycle accident around 8:20pm at the corner of W. Forest Ave and N. Hamilton St, August 09, 2013. An early 1990's, I believe a Chevrolet Corsica, tan/gold in color, made an illegal right turn from the far left lane in front of our motorcycle. The vehicle stopped briefly in the intersection after causing us to dump our bike, but quickly left after the Ypsi Fire Dept came on the scene.

I know that the first two pedestrians who spoke with us witnessed the accident, and appeared to be taking pictures/video of the scene. A third pedestrian, wearing a pink t-shirt, helped get our bike off of us and handed me my partners glasses. I'm sure he also witnessed the incident, and saw the vehicle leave the scene.

If you, or anyone you've spoke to had told you about this accident, or have pics/video if the incident, please contact me through this post. It can be done anonymously, we are looking for the driver of the vehicle who left the scene. Also, I'd like to thank the pedestrians, Ypsi firefighters, the fine paramedics of HVA, and Officer Thompson of Ypsi PD for all your help.

  • Location: W. Forest Ave at N. Hamilton St. Ypsi
  • it's NOT ok to contact this poster with services or other commercial interests

Posting ID: 3993561879

Posted: 2013-08-10, 4:16PM EDT

 email to a friend

item.title: Beer with Bloggers, organized by Mark Maynard. Corner Brewery, Ypsilanti, Tuesday April 9 2013 7-9pm
item.description:
I'm planning to go to Beer with Bloggers, a get-together organized by Mark Maynard.

An event for Michigan bloggers of all stripes, and the people who love them... No formal agenda. Just lots of talking over beer about blogs, politics, food, culture and the state of independent media.

Hope to see you there!

item.title: Detroit to Chicago via Amtrak, 1988 - Super 8 video
item.description: Please enjoy this video from Youtube user "trainluvr" in glorious Super 8 showing the trip from Detroit to Chicago on Amtrak. The whole journey takes just 8 minutes, 16 seconds in time lapse. For a detailed log of every location in the trip, see this Trainsim thread, Amtrak Cab Ride Timelapse. Ypsilanti is at 0:58, Ann Arbor is at 1:06, Battle Creek at 2:49, Niles at 5:40 and Chicago at 7:34.

item.title: Ypsilanti, Michigan to adopt more stringent Open Meetings Act rules
item.description:
YPSILANTI - A very straightforward yet revolutionary approach to open meetings in Ypsilanti says that every subcommittee of City Council must abide by the Michigan Open Meetings Act - including providing advance notice of meetings - just in case enough council members show up to form a quorum.

Ypsilanti Citizen story:

The OMA resolution, which was added to council’s agenda at 5 p.m. on Oct. 20, was discussed in relation to the approval of the Ypsilanti Downtown Development Authority bylaws - a separate agenda item at the meeting.

Murdock said the resolution is simply about “having meetings where decisions are made open to the public.”

Although he had previous discussions with City Manager Ed Koryzno during Council’s goal-setting sessions in January, Murdock moved forward with the resolution Oct. 20, when the DDA violated the Open Meetings Act earlier in the month by having a quorum, or more than seven members of the board, participate at a planning committee meeting.

the Advance Ypsilanti PAC notes that the resolution snuck in at the last possible minute

Sadly, the process by which this open meetings resolution was enacted is exactly the opposite of an open process. This is not just ironic, but suspect.

For instance, consider that this resolution was sent to the city clerk and posted to the council packets at 4:16 p.m. the day of the city council meeting, less than 3 hours before council was to convene. AY PAC asks ‘why’? There was no emergency, no timeline that needed to be met on this issue. There was no pressing need that forced this to be addressed and resolved THAT NIGHT.

If anyone can inform AY PAC as to why this was so urgent that it needed to be addressed in a timeline that included NO opportunity for public comment and little reflection by council, we welcome the information.

The back story is the Ypsi DDA meeting in October 2008 which was held in closed session, in evident violation of the Open Meetings Act.  From YpsiNews (Steve Pierce) at the time:

(October 7, 2008) During a meeting of the Ypsilanti Downtown Development, the DDA board violated not one, but two sections of the Open Meetings Act.

The Director of the Ypsilanti DDA, Brian Vosburg, called an emergency closed session meeting to be held on Friday, October 3, 2008 at 12 noon. The purpose of the meeting was to meet with DDA attorney Tammie Tischler.

The DDA Director said in the meeting notice the “Closed Session (is) to consider material exempt from discussion or disclosure by state or federal statute - (Open Meetings Act 15.268, Section 8(h))”

However, neither the DDA Director nor the DDA attorney would cite which state or federal statute exempts the DDA from the Open Meetings Act. Failing to publicly state the reason for a closed session is a violation of the Open Meetings Act.

item.title: Granholm, Dingell to present check for Ypsi Freighthouse rehab
item.description:
via Mark Maynard

all links go back to Ypsiwiki

Washtenaw County

The city of Ypsilanti will restore the historic Ypsilanti Freighthouse located in Depot Town. The project will include major structural improvements to the foundation, floor, walls, pilasters, roof and interior mechanical systems. These items, outlined in a Conditional Assessment Report, are required to re-open the 1878 facility, which is planned to serve as a community center, farmers market, café and education center. The budget for this Recovery Act project is $500,000.

party like it's 1878!

Friday 10 April 2009 at 9:30am has a ceremonial ceremony in Depot Town.  If anyone is going there from along the Old M-17 corridor or the Ypsi-Ann Interurban corridor and would like a shared ride let me know.

item.title: Put a local coupon in your weblog: November 2008 edition
item.description:
Mark Maynard, Ypsilanti, November 2008: Cafe Luwak

This month, the MM.com special can be found at Cafe Luwak, where, if you buy one sandwich, you’ll get one free… And the same goes for those urban elitist coffee drinks known as lattes… Seriously, how better to celebrate an Obama win in Michigan than with the official drink of the liberal elite?

Todd Waller, Team366, morgan and york, $5 off on $50 w/coupon (PDF)).  Visit Todd Waller's Ann Arbor real estate blog.

(Any more?  send them in.)
